intro: Mastixia eugenioides, commonly known as the silky gum, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by woody pods containing elongated seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry sclerophyll forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
